summary: Semiconductors (or chips) are critical to nearly all industries, and most are made overseas. To ensure a reliable U.S. supply, the Department of Commerce was authorized to finance projects to build or improve domestic manufacturing facilities. We looked at the projects Commerce selected, how it chose them, and how it determined funding amounts. As of July 2025, Commerce had awarded $30.9 billion across 40 projects...
title: Semiconductors: Information on Projects Funded to Strengthen U.S. Supply Chain
